docs.abstract: Michael H Doll letter says obesity remains a serious health problem even if it is not cause premature death (S)
docs.lead_paragraph: To the Editor: Re ''Study Shows Obesity Poses Less of a Risk Than Thought'' (news article, Jan. 1):
docs.snippet: To the Editor:    Re ''Study Shows Obesity Poses Less of a Risk Than Thought'' (news article, Jan. 1):

headline.main: Doctor's Work Ties Genes to Disease

docs.abstract: Article on work of Dr Michael Swift, director of Institute for Gene Analysis of Common Diseases at New York Medical College division in Hawthorne, NY; photo (M)
docs.lead_paragraph: IT began as an on-the-spot inspiration. It has become a life's work. ''As a junior faculty member at N.Y.U. Medical Center, I was asked to give grand rounds to discuss a very rare genetic disease with a high cancer incidence,'' Dr. Michael Swift of Scarsdale said, referring to the teaching tours conducted for medical students. ''It was one that had been discussed very well the previous two years, including by the person who named the disease. ''I knew I couldn't rehash. I hit upon the idea that people who carried one copy of the gene might be at elevated risk of cancer. And these were common where the disease itself was rare. ''To my surprise, the idea was very well received.''

headline.main: New Study Reduces Death Risk From Fat

docs.lead_paragraph: Obesity increases the likelihood of premature death but not as much as many medical experts had suspected, according to the largest study ever conducted on the health risks of the condition.
docs.snippet: Obesity increases the likelihood of premature death but not as much as many medical experts had suspected, according to the largest study ever conducted on the health risks of the condition.

docs.lead_paragraph: INTERNATIONAL A3-9 Validity of General Election In Kenya is Questioned The validity of Kenya's general election was questioned as irregularities were reported and violence plagued the country after two days of chaotic voting. So far, eight people have died. It was expected that all parties were setting the stage to challenge the elections results, raising fears of more political unrest. A4 Mexican Village Mourns Dead In Acteal, a village in the southern region of Chiapas, about 1,000 people marched to commemorate 45 Tzotzil Indians gunned down last week. Since the killings, the countryside has become split between supporters for the Zapatistas and those who support the ruling party in Mexico, PRI. Although the villagers in Acteal are officially neutral in the struggle, they fear future attacks. A8

headline.main: Study Shows Obesity Poses Less of a Risk Than Thought

docs.abstract: Largest study ever conducted on health risks of obesity finds that it increases likelihood of premature death, but only by modest degree; increased risk is slight by age 65, and disappears by age 74, possibly because people most susceptible to fat-related diseases are already dead; lead author, Dr June Stevens of University of North Carolina, analyzed data collected by American Cancer Society, using body mass index as fat measure (S)
docs.lead_paragraph: The largest study ever conducted on the health risks of obesity has found that it increases the likelihood of premature death but not as much as many medical experts had suspected. The research, being published today in The New England Journal of Medicine, analyzed the fates of 324,135 white adults who were followed for 12 years. The study found that the excess risk of dying associated with being fat was relatively modest and declined as people aged. By age 65, the increased risk was slight, and by age 74 it had disappeared.
